intro: Allosorus subverticillatus, commonly known as the clustered wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped white or pale pink flowers in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically arranged in whorls, giving it a distinctive appearance. Allosorus subverticillatus thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
